text: :For the article about a Canadian physician see Thomas Chang Thomas S. K. Chang (1948-1996) was an American reproductive biologist. He was born in Hawaii in 1948, and earned a bachelor's degree and Ph.D from the University of Hawaii in 1970 and 1976. In 1977, he came to The Johns Hopkins School of Hygiene and Public Health to carry out his postdoctoral studies. In 1981, he joined the Department of Urology of The Johns Hopkins School of Medicine to carry out his postdoctoral studies. His studies focus on male infertility in relationship to sperm physiology and endocrinology. The Thomas S. K. Chang Merit Award, established in 1996, is awarded annually by the American Society of Andrology.Thomas S. K. Chang Merit Award, American Society of Andrology. Accessed 2019-08-30. ==References== ==External links== *Donald S. Coffey and Barry R. Zirkin,In Memoriam. Dr. Thomas S.K. Chang, 1948-1996, Biology of Reproduction, vol. 55 (1996), no. 3, p. 729; Category:1948 births Category:1996 deaths Category:American biologists Category:Scientists from Hawaii Category:University of Hawaii alumni Category:20th-century biologists
title: Thomas S. K. Chang
